item.title: Website is ready
item.description: Today I finally figured out why I always got an error message when trying to configure the “custom resource records” in Google Domains' DNS. I found this post and did the same mistake of overlooking a plus sign. I’ve just fixed it and now my website https://jubarlystudio.com/ is finally online. I also added a top level post About this website.

item.title: Deep blue sea above the headboard
item.description: Above the bed’s headboard in our bedroom, FC and I currently hang a small painting on the wall. It’s a 50 cm by 40 cm oil painting that I made in 2019. It looks like this: An oil painting by myself (Spree at Night - oil on canvas, 50 cm x 40 cm, link to Instagram) is hanging on the wall above our headboard. item.title: About me
item.description: Dr. Wei-Chun Chu is a visual artist working and living in Berlin. Chu was born in Taipei, Taiwan. He developed a great interest in both art and science since childhood. At age of 18 he went to study physics at National Taiwan University. An year later he joined the university’s Fine Art Club and study oil painting under several tutors, including celebrity painter and songwriter Yu-Wei Hsieh and Chang-Lun Lin of the Rembrandt Art Studio in Taipei.

item.title: Artist statement
item.description: As a visual artist, my greatest interest is to explore different light effects such as transmission, reflection, diffusion etc, in both representational and non-representational settings. In the representational setting, the primary theme of my works is the modern life of our time, especially in Berlin. With such a specific geographic scope, the aim is to capture the atmosphere and people’s daily activities, and very importantly, the rapid transformation of the look of the city itself.
